data.title: Ira Ray Barnett (1922-2002)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Ray Barnett born 1922 Sulphur Springs, Hopkins, Texas, United States died 2002 Clyde, Callahan, Texas, United States including research + children + 3 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Son of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 10 Mar 2023 | Created 22 Sep 2010

This page has been accessed 217 times.

Biography

PFC Ray Barnett was Prisoner of War of the Japanese during World War II.

CPL Ray Barnett served in the United States Marine Corps in World War II

Service started: 26 Jul 1940

Unit(s):

Service ended: 18 Apr 1946

Ray was born in 1922 and died in 2002. He was the son of John Wesley Barnett (1870–1942) and Sarah Lela Pennington (1878–1960).

Birth: He was born on 17 August 1922 in Sulphur Springs, Texas. [1]

Military Service: Ira Barnett served in the Marine Corps during World War II and fought in the battle of Bataan and the defense of Corregider until it's surrender. Ray was a prisoner of war for three and a half years in the Philippines and in Japan. He was finally liberated from Osaka Main Camp Chikko Osaka 34-135, Japan. [2] [3] [4]

Marriage: He married Lillian Marie (Elms) Barnett (1922-2005) on 9 October 1945 in Brownwood, Texas. [5]

Children: They had three children; Brenda Rae Barnett (1947-1947), Danna and Randall Barnett.

Death: He died on 21 August 2002 in Clyde, Texas. [6]

Burial: He is buried in Greenleaf Cemetery, Brownwood, Texas. [7]

Sources
